result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Anthony Morales

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Johnny Anthony Morales.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Johnny Anthony Morales.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Court sets cash bail at $750.00. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with CKL (DOB: 01/06/1991)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Johnny Anthony Morales appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Johnny Anthony Morales.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defense request to be heard at next hearing. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
